description: PLANNING APPLICATION TO RETAIN GARDEN BUILDING WITH BASEMENT
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan and drawing AR/010/A

Condition : 2 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 3 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes incidental to the residential use of the dwelling known as 207 Aragon Road. Reason; To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring residents, to prevent the unauthorised introduction of an independent use and to ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM D2 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant was offered the opportunity to submit amended plans in order to clarify matters to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.
   ii) The application was approved within the agreed time frame.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant should be aware that Building Control approval is likely to be required for the proposed development, separate to any requirement for planning permission. it is the responsibility of the landowner to address any relevant legislation relating to building standards.
